description: Manages a Schedule Rotation within Opsgenie.

Type.description: This parameter should be set to `time-of-day` or `weekday-and-time-of-day`.

EndHour.description:
Value of the hour that frame will end.
* `end_min` - (Required) Value of the minute that frame will end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

EndMin.description: Value of the minute that frame will end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

StartHour.description:
Value of the hour that frame will start.
* `start_min` - (Required) Value of the minute that frame will start. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.
* `end_hour` - (Required) Value of the hour that frame will end.
* `end_min` - (Required) Value of the minute that frame will end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

StartMin.description:
Value of the minute that frame will start. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.
* `end_hour` - (Required) Value of the hour that frame will end.
* `end_min` - (Required) Value of the minute that frame will end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

EndDay.description:
Value of the day that frame will end.
* `end_hour` - (Required) Value of the hour that frame will end.
* `end_min` - (Required) Value of the minute that frame will end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

EndHour.description:
Value of the hour that frame will end.
* `end_min` - (Required) Value of the minute that frame will end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

EndMin.description: Value of the minute that frame will end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

StartDay.description:
Value of the day that frame will start.
* `start_hour` - (Required) Value of the hour that frame will start
* `start_min` - (Required) Value of the minute that frame will start. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.
* `end_day` - (Required) Value of the day that frame will end.
* `end_hour` - (Required) Value of the hour that frame will end.
* `end_min` - (Required) Value of the minute that frame will end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

StartHour.description:
Value of the hour that frame will start
* `start_min` - (Required) Value of the minute that frame will start. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.
* `end_day` - (Required) Value of the day that frame will end.
* `end_hour` - (Required) Value of the hour that frame will end.
* `end_min` - (Required) Value of the minute that frame will end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

StartMin.description:
Value of the minute that frame will start. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.
* `end_day` - (Required) Value of the day that frame will end.
* `end_hour` - (Required) Value of the hour that frame will end.
* `end_min` - (Required) Value of the minute that frame will end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

EndDate.description: This parameter takes a date format as (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ) (e.g. 2019-06-11T08:00:00+02:00). Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

Length.description: Length of the rotation with default value 1.

StartDate.description: This parameter takes a date format as (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ) (e.g. 2019-06-11T08:00:00+02:00). Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

Type.description: Type of rotation. May be one of daily, weekly and hourly.
